definition: once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
once/already/ever (in the past)/former/previously/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
lit. having crossed the vast ocean (idiom)/fig. widely experienced in the vicissitudes of life
there are no rivers to one who has crossed the ocean, and no clouds to one who has passed Mount Wu (idiom)/one who has seen the world doesn't stop at small things
pinyin: ceng2 jing1 cang1 hai3 nan2 wei2 shui3 , chu2 que4 Wu1 Shan1 bu4 shi4 yun2
containing_words.word: 曾经沧海难为水，除却巫山不是云

sentences.english: Once (he was)a worker , Pang Long now becomes a famous singer.
sentences.chinese: 庞龙曾经是个工人，现在变成一位著名的歌手。

sentences.english: Loves had arrived place, was keeping yesterday's fragrance according to the past.
sentences.chinese: 爱曾经来到过的地方，依昔留着昨天的芬芳。

sentences.english: He had cleared them out three years ago but they had all come back in again.
sentences.chinese: 祂三年前曾经把他们赶出去，但不久又回复旧观。

sentences.english: The draft has been handed to the bank on clean collection.
sentences.chinese: 汇票曾经交银止按光票托收。

sentences.english: Have you ever bought toys at a fast food restaurant?
sentences.chinese: 你曾经在一个快餐店里买过玩具吗？

sentences.english: Albert Einstein's parents feared he was sub-normal.
sentences.chinese: 爱因斯坦的父母当初曾经担心他发育不正常。

sentences.english: She married and divorced twice, stripping both husbands of their cash.
sentences.chinese: 她曾经结婚两次，把两任丈夫的钱全部洗劫了。

sentences.english: No problem, I once played a 2-meter-high player successfully.
sentences.chinese: 没问题，我曾经成功的防守一个2米高的球员。

sentences.english: I only know that it happened because at some stage I awoke.
sentences.chinese: 我只知道有这么回事，因为在这个过程中我曾经醒过。

sentences.english: If you have been to Yangshuo, you must have been surprised by its green mountains and clear rivers.
sentences.chinese: 如果你曾经去过阳朔，你一定惊讶于那里青山碧水。

sentences.english: Income luggage was happy to be your shadow installed between heart.
sentences.chinese: 把曾经的快乐收入行囊，将你的身影装在心间。

sentences.english: Detective Barton : And yet, you got engaged to the man who murdered your husband.
sentences.chinese: 不一定，你曾经和谋杀你丈夫的人定了婚。

sentences.english: Heir to an industrial past, the region has turned towards tourism.
sentences.chinese: 曾经工业的继承者，而如今这里已转向旅游业。

sentences.english: I've heard about you from Mr. Li.
sentences.chinese: 我曾经听李先生提起过你。

sentences.english: This song have got a lot of awards in hong kong.
sentences.chinese: 曾经攞过好多合唱歌曲奖既歌。

sentences.english: I had to go to hospital to have my nose cauterised and treated.
sentences.chinese: 我以前曾经去医院治疗过鼻子。

definition: once/already/ever (in the past)/former/previously/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
in those days/then/in those years/during that time
many times/on more than one occasion
he or him/(used for either sex when the sex is unknown or unimportant)/(used before sb's name for emphasis)/(used as a meaningless mock object)/other/another
